item.title: Health Secretary RFK Jr. grilled on vaccines and more during Senate hearing
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was questioned by senators from both parties on Thursday about vaccine access and more. NPR analyzes the health secretary's nearly three-hour appearance.

item.title: Why solar flares are way hotter than researchers thought
item.description: The hottest parts of the sun are its solar flares, and a new study suggests these flares could be more than six times hotter than scientists used to believe.

item.title: Chinese public is divided over whether to seek global dominance or share leadership
item.description: A new poll shows a majority of Chinese people see competition with the U.S. as a threat, but there is a split on what role Beijing should take on in the world stage.

item.title: The world's oldest and largest iceberg will soon be no more
item.description: The iceberg, known as A23a, has been on a journey following the current into warmer waters for months. Now, it has begun the predicted and natural process of breaking apart, and eventually melting.
